Short and sweet, Portal gave birth to a unique concept at the time, and it still holds up today. A brilliant experience, somewhat overshadowed by it's much more fleshed out sequel. Still, it's worth your time.

I recommend the game, but not challenges.
To get gold in most of them you actually have to use speedrunning strats and glitches. To me that's simply unfair since how would you ever be able to know them without looking things up? And even when you know the strats it takes quite a while to execute them in a way that will grant you gold.

I didn't really enjoy this. Portal 2 was a lot longer and cleaner with more dialogue and story. More structured puzzles instead of a bunch of random things you had to do in this game. Maybe it was interesting when in game out (15 years ago, impressive!), but I wouldn't recommend it today. Still enjoyed the ending theme though.

19 different pussles (excluding bonus levels), all unique and will definetly make you have to think outside the box. Sometimes literally. I'd say first game takes 4 hours minimum maybe 3.5 if you're speedrunning although why would you speedrun the first game, 5 hours if you're really slow. I also had very few moments where i felt completely lost, but there's always something new you can try and i were never felt lost for long. And the times it happened where I'm like "wtf do i do here???" you can always try something stupid or not and It's almost always rewarding. Quite the ending too. Very good for only 8 bucks, and even less in the orange box.
It's Portal, what more do you want?
